message: My new faves are carrots and hummus, kale chips and since getting off my braces I am really enjoying eating apples without cutting them up first!
Pumpkin hummus.  Oh yeah, I said it (grin)
mmm yes i love hummus! never had pumpkin hummus before--sounds great!
I mostly eat fresh fruit or raw carrots and celery. I love peanut butter but that isn't low calorie lol!
I know...peanut butter should be a 'zero fat' thing...sigh
@jackiedee1  @KarenneLyn have you tried my low fat pb (p. 253) it's still not low cal, but its lower in fat
One of my fave snacks is jicama with lime juice!
Jicama with lime juice sounds good.  How do you make the pumpkin hummus????
Pumpkin Hummus...basically your favorite plain hummus recipe and add a can of pumpkin until the taste is right.  Sorry that is all the instructions I got (grin)
@KarenneLyn I'm going to try this -- I've been meaning to work on a new hummus recipe
Definitely going to try the pumpkin hummus.
That is awesome Lindsay.  I bet yours tastes better than mine LOL
I don't have the cook book yet for the pb recipe. Look forward to trying it though. thanks!

@jackiedee1 oh your life will change with this cookbook.  I actually (hate to admit this) picked up the book based on the cover as an impulse buy.  The book I meant to pick up (sticks tongue out at book) Lindsay's book...my new cooking heart!  My hubby even asks what are we having next?  (not a stalker) but I love you Lindsay.  I was able to get my hubby to eat right (wipes a tear from my eye)

@KarenneLyn, I know how you feel! I was SO happy when my 'meat-atarian' boyfriend said he actually preferred the sour cream from the book to the real stuff. I almost passed out from shock, and then happily made a bigger batch. :)
@KarenneLyn you know how to make a girl blush!
Chopped apple with a dash of Cinnamon  yummy!
Clementines!  Veggies, especially red bell peppers, with hummus.
